alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 2:14AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cooke and central Grayson Counties through 300 AM CST... At 213 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Marietta to near Lindsay. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Callisburg around 235 AM CST. Whitesboro around 240 AM CST. Pottsboro and Lake Texoma around 250 AM CST. Eisenhower State Park and Randell Lake around 255 AM CST. Sherman and Knollwood around 300 AM CST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Dixie, Boddie, Preston, Southmayd, Sturgeon, Ambrose, Sadler, Locust, Sivells Bend and Gordonville. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 495 and 503. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
